dialogues.text: What's your marketing strategy? How do you plan to return us to profitability?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I give Bud an opportunity to answer that. Darien and Carl turn to Bud, who puts down his wine glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Mr. Gekko. First of all I want you to know my door will always be open to you cause I know from my Dad it's you guys that keep Bluestar flying. One -- Modernize. Our computer software is weak, we update it, we squeeze every dollar out of each seat and mile flown. You don't sell a seat to a guy for $89 when he's willing to pay $389. Effective inventory management through computerization will increase our load factor by 5 to 20%, that translates to approximately 50 to 200 million dollars in revenues; the point is, we can beat the majors at a price war. Two -- Advertising -- more, more, and aggressive, attack the majors. Three -- expand our hubs to Atlanta, North Carolina and Dallas, reorganize all our feeder schedules, think Big -- guys, we're going after the majors! The men are visibly shaken by Bud's determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking for reactions)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cards are on the table. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (restrained, hopeful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you mean what you say, I think we're in the ball park. I'll take it to my people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approvingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've sketched some broad strokes. I'd like to see the fine print. But so far so good. Gekko looks to Carl Fox who, putting down knife and fork, breaks his silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess if a man lives long enough, he gets to see everything. And I mean everything. What else do you have in your bag of tricks, Mr. Gekko? Bud tenses, looking at his father. Gekko ignores the innuendo and replies softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, Carl, I can't see giving much more. If you have any suggestions I'll be glad to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There came into Egypt a Pharoah who did not know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon. Is that a proverb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a prophecy. The rich have been doing it to the poor since the beginning of time. The only difference between the Pyramids and the Empire State Building is that the Egyptians didn't have unions. (looking at Wilmore and Carpenter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what this guy is about-- greed--he's in and out for the buck and he don't take prisoners. He don't give a damn about Northstar or us ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, wait a minute, Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, keeping his composure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. What's worth doing is worth doing for money. It's a bad bargain where nobody gains. And if this deal goes through, we all gain. Carl throws down his napkin, rises from the chair, looks the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Bud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course my son did work three summers as a baggage handler and freight loader. With those qualifications, why should I doubt his ability to run an airline? There is frozen silence at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, if you don't want us, stay with the scum in present management--dedicated to running you and Bluestar into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that "scum" built this company up from one plane in thirty years, they made something out of nothing, and if that's a scum I'll take one over a rat any day... Carl turns and leaves. Bud glances at Gekko, reading his piercing look. He hurries after his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud catches up to Carl, waiting for the elevator, hammeri him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seething)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You did a great job of embarrassing me in there-- not to mention yourself! Save the "workers of the world unite" speech for next time Dad, I heard it too much growing up. You're gonna get axed Dad, no two ways about it, you and the whole airline are going down the tubes, you hear me, just like Braniff, you don't have a chance in hell, and if it isn't Gekko it's gonna be some other killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl steps into the elevator, Bud follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got your prick in his back pocket, son, and you're standing naked in the display window of Macy's. He's using you. Only you're too blind to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what I see is a jealous old machinist who can't stand that his son's become more successful than himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you see, son, is a man who never measured success by the size of a man's wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you never had the guts to go out into the world and stake your claim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lamentably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, if that's what you think, I must've really screwed up my job as a father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud and Carl exit the elevator and head across the luxury lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as far as being axed, I'm still here and as long as I am, I have a responsibility not just to me but to the union members I represent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your responsibility, Dad, is to present the facts, not your opinions, to the men... you're gonna destroy their lives, Dad! Don't do it to 'em. Give it a chance. Let the membership decide for themselves, Dad. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned that when my men come to me tomorrow morning, wanting to know what's going on, I'm going to lie to them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your men! All my life "your men" have been able to count on you? Why is it that you've never been there for me? They head through the doors, out onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud following Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if you're wrong? What if one day, the sun didn't rise in the East and birds didn't fly South in winter and for once in your life your compass was off? Huh? He grabs Carl by the arm, stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you be willing to wreck your men's future? My future? Please... Dad. Think. Be practical, for a change. I'm asking you, I'm fucking begging you... Bud lets go of Carl's arm. Carl looks at his son, seeing desperation. Sadness and confusion take hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't sleep with no whore and I don't wake up with no whore. That's how I live with myself, Buddy. I don't know how you do. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I'm wrong, I'll let them decide for themselves, that much I promise you. He walks away. Bud watches him go, knows he has won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, increasingly frazzled and determined, dark circles under his eyes paces with the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his secretary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dixon Brandt on 3...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily switching over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up Dixon? (stopping, focusing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down! What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dixon, the rich man's son and ski bum, is yelling on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...this guy who said he was from the Security Exchange Commission, whatever the hell that is, calls and wants to ask me about that stock I bought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him I was in the bathroom and I'd call him right back. What the hell was I supposed to say Buddy, you got me into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Dixon, calm down! It's not illegal to buy stock or to be right. And it's not all that unusual to be spot checked on a big buy. Tell him you did your homework and you thought the stock was a sound investment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he asks where I got the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em your father gave it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't. That's not their jurisdiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Read the Constitution, it's all in there. And remember--you don't know anything, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Then call him back. And call me back. Don't worry. He hangs up, a worried expression, Marv entering to break his concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you hear the news. I just got a job at a new firm: "Dewey, Cheat 'em and Howe." Yuk yuk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I tell you to knock before you came in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey the door was open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get out and close it behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what you need, buddy buddy--an optorectomy. That's when they cut the nerve that runs from your brain to your rectum--to change that shitty attitude of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out! Marv slams the door on his way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long shot of the towering stone structure. A tall angular figure crosses through the glass doors with a bulky folde under his arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man flashes his ID to a SECURITY GUARD who buzzes him through the gate... He walks towards us and we see he is familiar tall, baby-faced INVESTIGATOR from the S.E.C. Options Watch Office... he gets in an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks into the office of a CHIEF INVESTIGATOR. A baldi sharp-featured man in a drab suit with bags of hard work under his eyes looks up as the young investigator places large file in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud enters, preoccupied. Barnes is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...got a strange call from the SEC. They asked to see my records... Bud, this is a heavy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....Relax Roget (French pronunciation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're 82M in the account numbers and I'm the Invisible Man... they're always looking for red flags, Gekko's always getting checked by them, they never come up with anything... we're invulnerable on this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... I just wanna slow down Bud... no more calls for awhile, no lunches... we suspend our business, alright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure Roger, whatever you want, it's cool. A young lawyer pops his head in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rog, come on, bring the cost report. They started. (exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing, to Bud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gekko asked us into the Bluestar deal. We're reviewing the timetables, wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never told me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just the President of the company, what do you know? ... Come on. As they walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoky, coffee cups and food. THREE LAWYERS, TWO INVESTMEN BANKERS, THREE COMMERCIAL BANKERS, sleeves rolled up, tie askew. A blackboard with Bluestar's assets diagrammed. A combat mood in the room. Bud walking in, feels vaguely worried, something is not quite right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys know the new chief of Bluestar... Bud Fox. They nod vaguely respectful but Bud's obviously a figure head to them, takes a seat off to the side. The bull-like INVESTMENT BANKER, Vietnam vet, in shirt and suspenders, on the attack against the stuffier Commercial Bankers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look guys, what's the problem, let's for the kill...Gekko's got 12% and climbing plus the unions are in his pocket for now, everybody on the street knows the stock's in play (overlapping voice: up 2 1/4 since the open)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: by next week the street's gonna own Bluestar and management won't be able to do anything but poison their own pill. Why are you guys dicking around? Is the bank financing in place or are we gonna have more and more meetings? Our firm's gonna guarantee 25% of the total debt structure in long-term junk bonds, now you guys either sign this piece of paper right now or we're gonna pull and head for another bank for the 75...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (older man, appeasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...look, we have 30 banks ready to participate in a 4 year revolving credit line but we have to have your assurance to pay back most of the loan in the first 6 months, and the only way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intermittently interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 30 banks, isn't that wonderful...you got it, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the only way we can see this happening is liquidating the hangars and the planes. Can you people guarantee that? Bud freezes where he sits...it all comes crashing down in milli-second on that word "liquidate" -- shock now spread on Bud's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guaranteed! No sweat...we already got the Bleezburg brothers lined up to build condos where the hangars are, we can lay off the planes with Mexicana, who are dumb enough to buy 'em and Texas Air is drooling at my kneecaps to get the slots and the routes. What's the problem? it's done..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing a paper to the commercial banker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the pricetag on the 737s, the gates, the hangars, the routes, we got it all nailed right down to the typewriters... Bud sits there numbly, a sickening feeling taking hold of him as the camera and music track and trap him tighter an tighter. The lawyers' voices distorting in the background

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...'course the beauty of it is the overfunded pension fund. Gekko gets the 75 million in there. Fifty million buys him the minimum annuities for 6,000 employees and he walks away with the rest. All in, he'll net 60 to 70 million. Not bad for a month's work. (to Bud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your man did his homework, Fox, you're gonna have the shortest executive career since the Pope who got poisoned...now he'll really start believing he's "Gekko the Great."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud walks intently past the receptionist and down the lon white marble hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is on the phone. Bud marches past her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he wants to change that appointment to... (cupping the receiver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud--you can't go in there. He's in a meeting! He ignores her and throws open Gekko's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gekko is talking with the LAWYERS and BANKERS from the Bluestar deal, as Bud barges in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know we had a meeting schedule for this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, this can't wait. Gekko stares at him with piercing eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you gentlemen excuse us for a few minutes? The lawyers and bankers get up and discreetly leave the r Gekko waits for them to go, turns back to Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found out about the garage sale down at Bluestar. Why? Gekko is taken by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night I read Rudy the story of Winnie the Pooh and the Honey pot. Know what happened: he stuck his nose in that honey pot once too often and got stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you ought to read him Pinocchio. You told me you were going to turn Bluestar around. Not upside down. You used me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're walking around blind without a cane, sport. A fool and his money are lucky to get together in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need to wreck this company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's wreckable. I took another look and I changed my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If these people lose their jobs, nowhere to go. My father worked at Bluestar for twenty-four years. I gave 'em my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all about bucks, kid, the rest is conversation... (loosening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, you're still going to be president. And when the time comes, you'll parachute out a rich man. With the money you're going to make, your father won't have to work another day in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Gordon--when does it all end? How many yachts can you waterski behind? How much is enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, it's not a question of enough. It's a zero sum game, sport. Somebody wins and somebody loses. Money itself isn't lost or made, it's simply transferred from one perception to another. Like magic. That painting cost $60,000 10 years ago. I could sell it today for $600,000. The illusion has become real. And the more real it becomes, the more desperately they want it. Capitalism at its finest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is enough Gordon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The richest one percent of this country owns half the country's wealth: 5 trillion dollars. One third of that comes from hard work, two thirds of it comes from inheritance, interest on interest accumulation to widows and idiot sons and what I do -- stock and real estate speculation. It's bullshit. Ninety percent of the American people have little or no net worth. I create nothing; I own. We make the rules, Buddy, the news, war, peace, famine, upheaval; the cost of a paper clip. (picking one up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull the rabbit out of the hat while everybody else sits around their whole life wondering how we did it... (crosses to Bud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you're not naive enough to think we're living in a democracy are you, Buddy? It's the free market. You're one of us now...take advantage of it. You got the killer instinct, kid, stick with me. I got things to teach you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously... As he puts his arm around Bud, leading him to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, Buddy, I was gonna discuss this with you at the right time. Look, why don't you calm down and come to the apartment for dinner tonight. Bring Darien...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the door, confused, drained)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I can't make it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you with me Buddy? At the door, a look of unmistakable power...and danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you with me. (waits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you Gordon... He walks out the door, the misery he is in washing his br

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Natalie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...be another minute, Natalie. As he crosses back to the coffee table and punches up a phone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Gordon Gekko. Now... (a beat, with controlled rage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want zip-locked mouths on Bluestar, or I'm gonna personally come down there and rip out your fucking throats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud walks out, heading up the street, absent amid the scurrying mid-day hordes tearing up the street for the lo inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darien approaches, carrying groceries, enters the buildin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is slumped on the couch, a spent bottle of tequila in front of him. Outside the twilight is quickening into nig shadows, scurrying across the unlit room.... for the firs time we see him sucking on a cigarette. Darien opens the door and freezes, surveying the living r A broken vase on the carpet, a curtain ripped off a windo a painting upended, a chair overturned, selected but not frenzied damage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud?...What's going on? She puts down the grocery bags, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been played like a grand- piano--by the master, Gekko the Great...and today was the big crash. Liquidation sale. He's gonna carve Bluestar into little pieces and sell it all off... Darien registering this, is picking up pieces of the brok vase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I was afraid something like this could happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about being bent over the sink of life and being dry humped. I handed it to him on a silver platter. I told my father and those people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, it's not your fault, and it's not your decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let it happen Darien. She stops, lights a cigarette, growing concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cross Gordon. He'll crush you. You've worked hard to get where you are. If Gordon doesn't buy Bluestar someone else will; and who's to say they won't do the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I wouldn't be pulling the trigger. She sighs...comes over, tries to shake some sense into hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you mad! Why are you doing this! We're so close, the town is going to be ours. Don't throw away your future Bud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can stay with the brokerage firm. And you're doing fine. We can survive without Gordon Gekko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not looking to just survive. I've been doing that all my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting the drift)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's that supposed to mean? Darien moves out from his approximate circle, wrestling w what she wants to say...until she turns and says it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That if you make an enemy of Gordon Gekko, I won't be there to stand by you. Bud is stunned...and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really mean that? (lashing out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he promise you? To take you public? I guess without Gordon's money and seal of approval, I'm not such a hot investment anymore. You're just the best money can buy, Darien...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not exactly pure Bud, you went after Gekko with the same vengeance you went after me. Look in the mirror before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking...and I sure don't like what I see. She collects her things and walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough...but it's not that simple, Bud. When I was down and had nothing, it was Gordon who helped me. He got me all my clients -- you among them... (snaps her fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and he can take it away like that. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may find out one day -- that when you've had money and lost it, it's worse than never having had it at all. Bud steps across to her in a rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit! Step out that door, I'm changing the locks. She opens the door saddened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may not believe this Bud but I really do care for you. I think we could've made a good team...but that's how it goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out! She does. Bud stares at the closed door, mute, numb, tota devastated.... the loss is not just Darien, it is total.. He looks at his face in the reflection of a wall mirror..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for the elevator. Darien also looks at herself a beat in the hall mirror. She's crying. Then she steels herself and enters the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same realtor, SYLVIe DRIMMER, who sold him the place, back. The phone is ringing, unanswered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...well, the market's dead, hon, even the rich are bitching, nothing's moving except termites and cockroaches, and with my commission being what it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the rap, just sell it -- fast! He's in his socks, unshaven, smoking, he looks like he's been on a bender for the weekend. The phone stops ringing He turns and walks into the bedroom, slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud walks in, a different, more serious look in his eye, purposeful. Past CAROLYN and JANET at the outer desk. The stop what they're doing and look up at him surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud! Where you been the last two days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the tone in her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Janet get my father on the phone and the two other union reps, urgent... He notices her face, something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom just called, Mr. Fox. Your father... he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a heart attack, hon, but he's okay, he's at the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (runs out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud weaving fast through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud races past the nurses' desks and down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's MOTHER is outside with Dominick Amato and another neighbor just visiting, bringing candies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting a cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he was complaining about chest pains at work. Next thing I know he collapsed... Oh Buddy, talk to him, he's so stubborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...don't worry, he's got another 20 years in him. He's a tough ol' nut, your Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blinds are drawn. His Dad lies there, tubes down his nose, hooked up to an IV unit and monitors. Bud comes ove Carl, glassy-eyed, significantly frailer, nods to him. It obvious that more damage was done than Bud expected. Mom comes into the room with him, stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya Dad... (sits, smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it? Mom talked too much or was it her spaghetti? I mean pasta... (Mom bringing a handkerchief to her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you never to lift a 747 by yourself... Carl, smiles weakly, on pain killers. Bud pulls out a cigarette. He fumbles with it before putting it away, try to keep a gruff tone between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you even got me smoking now...second one Dad, you're pushing your luck, I guess you know that...I guess you gotta pull through this one Dad...for mom, for me...I guess I never told you but...I love you Dad, I love you more than I ever. (begins to weep)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I didn't mean those things I said to you...you're a hero all the way Dad, you're a rock...the best. The words seem to come flowing out of Bud as Carl's eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and you were right about Gekko. He's one son of a bitch...through and through. Carl stares at him, beginning to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna break up Bluestar. Carl reacts violently in his eyes but Bud soothes him...i dead earnest, trying to be deliberate and clear in his me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I gotta plan Dad, it can work, I can save the airline, I know you got no reason to believe me but I want you to trust me...I need to talk to the unions...Can I speak for you? Carl's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your words, not mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak for me, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gekko and Darien are seated together in the back row. Dar looks serious and distracted in spite of all the exciteme going on around her. It is the big spring Impressionist s and all the major players, or their representatives are h Gekko is bidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look over there sunshine. I'm up against Richard Feigen. He is on a roll, electric. As the price mounts and surpas the two million dollar mark, Gekko rises and walks down t side aisle to the front, never taking his eyes away from auctioneer. He stands agressively, arms akimbo, in a nose nose confrontation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once, twice, three times. Sold to Mr. Gordon Gekko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk the sunny streets, a jubilant Gekko, savoring h triumph, grabs Darien's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say we go get a suite at the Carlyle? Caviar? Champagne? Celebrate, just like the old times Sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those days are over, Gordon. They were over a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (condescendingly but paying little attention to the rebuff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't blame me for trying. You look as beautiful as that painting I just bought. He pats her on the back in a preprietary fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mockingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the problem Sunshine? You look like Black Thursday. Bad case of puppy love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not puppy love, Gordon. Anyway, Buddy and I are splitting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off handed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to hear that. I thought the kid had staying power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over you, Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cooly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told him about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, are you crazy? And I don't want him ever to know. Do you understand?... She moves closed and takes Gordon's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to ask you a big favor, Gordon. Please drop the Bluestar deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stroking her face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tell me, why would I want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't want to see him hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry Sunshine. Bud and I had a little talk. We came to an understanding. (takes her hand paternally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to go back to him. Soothe him. Help keep his head straight. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...and I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we both like Buddy. But this bleeding heart puppy love act is over the top... It doesn't fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it does. Don't patronize me Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I are the same, Darien. We're smart enough not to buy into the oldest myth running: love... A fiction created by people who got nothing to keep them from jumping out of windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really twisted, Gordon. You're incapable of giving to anybody because deep down inside you there's a poverty that every last dollar in the world won't fill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh ooh, tough talk from a scared little girl all wrapped in a pretty grown-up package. Does this mean you're ready to cut the umbilical cord and step out into the world on your own? Because, Darien, if you're through with me, you're through with everything I'm a part of. Darien's eyes cloud over...the look of a scared child bei banished by her father. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...but maybe, just maybe Gordon, I'm good enough so I don't need you anymore. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is seated at a corner table with the BLUESTAR UNION REPS: Duncan Wilmore, ALPA LEADER and Toni Carpenter, AFA rep; also jointed by machinists, Dominick Amato and Charl Dent, sitting in for his father's union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the stock's at 19 1/4 and it's going up. Gekko figures by breaking up Bluestar, it's worth at least $30 a share. That means he'll buy up to 23 or 24 and still think he's making money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that the stock is going to go up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't want to know any more than that, Mr. Wilmore. Let's just say I have some friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting his drift)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. What happens then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the stock hits 23, you guys go to Gekko and lower the boom. Once he learns he has no union concession, he's going to head for the hills. He'll sell everything he's got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But who's going to buy then and what's to prevent another shark from coming along and devouring us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, Duncan Wilmore, Toni Carpenter, Dominick and Charley an unlikely looking group in the plushness of the apartme lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an appointment to see Mr. Wildman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lofty windows overlooking the Park, an impeccably-decorat apartment with coffee and rolls laid out, a young AIDE quietly moving around. Bud and the others are on sofas around the imposing figure of Wildman in a chair across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Lawrence, what would you say to owning Bluestar Airlines with union concessions--at $18 a share...and in the process hanging Gordon Gekko out in the wind to twist.... ? Sir Lawrence leans back in his chair, equably...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might be very interested, but why? Why you mate -- how'd you get mixed up with Gekko? He doesn't know the difference between raiding and insider trading. I do. The SEC does. I hope you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say Mr. Gekko and I have a conflict of interest. I want to see this airline work... (pointing to the documents in front of Wildman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the figures here show it can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and you're prepared to take these large salary cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we are. But we want a contract agreement -- iron-clad -- that if you buy it, you can't break it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands behind his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud hurries in, past Marv on the phone with an irate cust

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if that's how you feel--the hell with you too. And strong letter to follow. He slams the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to agree with me, Marv; but I think I've been a bit of a schmuck lately. (beat, waits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the cuff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. Go thou and sin no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make it up to you. Bluestar, put all your clients in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (animated, grabs the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, buddy, buddy, I'm back. Say, Buddy, those optorectomies do work wonders. Bud intersecting Lou Mannheim smoking a cigarette and hav a hard time walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bluestar, Mr. Mannheim. Put all your clients in it. Davls looks gravely at Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where you get your information, son, but I don't like it. The only reason I'm gonna do it is...I need the money, that's the problem with money--it makes you do things you don't want to do. Bud hears him, walks on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Bloom, Marvin. You got cancer in your portfolio, but I got the cure...Bluestar Airlines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud on the phone, checking his quotron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen I need a favor and it's a quick scalp for you. Two hundred thousand at 19 1/2; can you position it in one of your equity funds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voicebox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...call waiting on 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on... (switches over, hushed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...listen "blue horseshoe loves Bluestar Airlines"... Immediately goes back to the other line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REPORTER, who Bud anonymously called on the earlier Anacott Steel buy, hangs up. He rises from his desk and crosses the busy news floor, over to his EDITOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bluestar's in play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUNNER dashes up to the BLUESTAR AIRLINES post, where a heated crowd is gathered, amidst heavy trading. He elbows his way over to a TRADER, handing him the ticket. The TRA holds up the buy order, screaming, making frantic hand signals, in search of a seller. Faces in the crowd look u at the broad tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUESTAR (BST), the stock quote flashing across the BROAD TAPE--upticking to 20 1/4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marv, on the phone pitching, eyes glued to the office TAP as BST jumps to 21 1/4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it...I do love it so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The quotron now climbs to 22 1/8!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I see it at 22 1/8 and I don't know what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces on the other end of the phone, real anger showin now Alex and Susan seen in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word's out. Your union buddies are talking. Get me in at a 45 degree angle and I mean all the way in! Slash and burn, buy everything you can get up to 22. Then call me. When I get the sonofabitch who leaked this I'm gonna kill him! I'm gonna tear his eyeballs out, I'm gonna suck his skull!! As he glances at his quotron the stock ticks up another 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the BROKERS have jumped into the action, avidly watch Bluestar's stock climb on the BROAD TAPE. Bud sweeps into the room and looks up at the board as the stock hits 22 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stock's going to Pluto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start unloading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! Tell everyone to dump! Marv nods, and rushes away. Bud crosses past Mannheim's o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of Bluestar! In background Marv is spreading the word, brokers frantic grabbing phones, calling clients to sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gekko looks up from his quotron and shouts to his troops the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell's out there? What are the arbs saying? It's gotta be a big hitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know what's going on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody and his mother is buying! Natalie enters the room, flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gekko, there's a whole bach of people from Bluestar Airlines outside demanding to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do they want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be happy to tell you. As Duncan, Toni Carpenter, Dominick Amato, Charley Dent a SEVERAL other assorted UNION MEMBERS march into the room. Gekko is taken by surprise, but stays calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know what you're up to, Gekko, and let me tell you this from here, (hits his heart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you suck eggs, mister, over my dead body you ain't gonna break up Bluestar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys must know something nobody else knows. If those are my plans, it's the first I've heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care to put that in writing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to remind you we already have an agreement, which I expect you to honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well in that case, I hope you have your pilot's license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Gekko, we wouldn't let the engines fall out of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regretfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the reservations systems can get awfully screwed up, if we're not paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLEY DENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a lot of baggage headed to St. Petersburg could easily find its way to Pittsburgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you clowns, there's somebody else out there trying to buy your airline, if you want to be Pac-manned and gobbled by Atilla the Hun be my guest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take our chances. (tips his hat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you again, Mr. Gekko. They file out of the room. The phone lines have lit up li a Christmas tree. Alex answers a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gekko)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox says Bluestar just hit 23. What do you want him to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fractional pause, mad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell it all. (then, evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, so I'll only make ten million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud switches lines from Gekko to Larry Wildman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gekko's on the ropes--he's trying to sell, but there's not many takers, the stock's plummeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wildman is off the Long Island Sound waters in his boat lighting a cigar. Two beautiful women and an aide are wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then... guess I'll have to carry him a few rounds before he drops. Switches lines, checking his quotron...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bluestar. Don't make a big deal. Buy it lightly on the way down. (emphatically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it hits 18--buy it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wildman's broker takes the order with a curt "got it" and dashes out of the cubicle over to the Bluestar post where chaotic crowd is gathered, traders frantically screaming sell Bluestar shares. He looks at the Big Board--sees an drop to 17. When he raises his hand to buy, he is mobbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Big Board...a series of snappy dissolves accompanied lively music shows the stock price falling to 16 1/2 ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, Ollie, Susan on the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arbs are getting killed. Where'd the buyers go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being devoured, Gordon. Harold Salt, walking on egg shells, looks to Gekko, who s with the phone receiver crooked to his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be a way out of this, Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (livid, losing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Harold, why don't you dial 911. (into the receiver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox, where the hell are you? I'm losing millions. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you got me into this airline, and you damn well better get me out. Because if you don't the only job you're going to get on the Street is sweeping it! You hear me, Fox--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud scribbling an order ticket, replies on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You once told me don't get emotional about stock. Gordon, don't. The bid is 17 and going down. As your broker, I advise you to take it. Bud moves the phone away from his ear, at Gekko's cursing and signs the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon, it's two minutes to close. What do you want to do?! Decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dump it. Bud hangs up and rushes off with the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 35" television is on to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big Wall Street story tonight is the  roller coaster ride of Bluestar Airlines. Fueled by takeover rumors, the stock soared to an all-time high of 24 1/8. Then when contradictory rumors later surfaced that the takeover was unfounded, buyers went running for cover, and the stock plummeted on gigantic volume to as low as 16 1/2 before closing at 17. Camera discovers Gekko sitting, grimly watching the repor Rudy seen riding his toy car in background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but then tonight, amidst all the scuttlebutt, another rumble shook (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to many sources, raider Sir Lawrence Wildman has stepped in and bought a substantial block of Bluestar and is going to announce a deal tomorrow at 18 that includes the support of the unions. Camera now tracks in close on Gekko as he absorbs the unexpected blow. O.S. Rudy yelling and squealing. Gekko leans back, putting the pieces together, his eyes narrowi into burning slits. He smashes the glass cocktail table w a massive paperweight as Kate hears it, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People rushing to work. Bud crosses the street, his face buried in The Financial Times. Insert: "SIR LAWRENCE WILD MOUNTS BLUESTAR BUY WITH UNION SUPPORT". Satisfied, Bud folds the paper and heads into his office building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks past Carolyn the receptionist who is strangely m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile, Carolyn, there's justice in the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes the CHINESE STOCKLADY. She sees him and manages look away. Marvin exchanges a look with him but can't bri himself to talk. Bud wonders...the whole office seems silent, the other BROKERS stealing glances. ...as he passes Lou Mannheim with Charlie Cushing, who ignores Bud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going Mr. Mannheim? Got out of Bluestar in time I hope? Mannheim stops, winds up. Bud impatient but polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with gruff affection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud I like you, just remember something. Man looks in the abyss, there's nothing staring back at him. At that time a man finds his character--and that is what keeps him out of the abyss... (a beat, looks deeply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I understand what you mean Mr. Mannheim. But not really. As, on this increasingly strange morning, moves on past Janet who wants to tell his something but h cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get my father will you Janet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bud walks in, the camera glides to reveal the young SE INVESTIGATOR, who has been tracking Buddy, going through files. A SECOND MAN, PATTERSON, is standing behind the de using the phone as a bored-looking 3RD MAN and POLICEMAN stand off to the side with Hieronymus Lynch, who gives Bu withering glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just came in. I'll talk to you later. On Bud--a struck-dumb look passing to resignation, as if a long time now, he has been expecting this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're not here to open an IRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Fox, I'm Henry Patterson from the Postal Inspection Service... this is Evan Morrissey with The Securities and Exchange Investigation Office. (presents his ID and indicates MAN 3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mr. Ebanhopper from the US Attorney's Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fox, you're under arrest for conspiracy to commit securities fraud and for violating the Insider Trader's Sanction Act. The handcuffs come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long shot. Activity is winding down, a few sunbathers collecting their blankets. A solitary figure stands on a hill silhouetted by the sunset. A second figure appears o footpath and starts climbing the hill towards the other m Gekko waits, expressionless... Bud approaches him. They stand facing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sandbagged me on Bluestar. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you think you taught the teacher a lesson, that you can make the tail wag the dog, huh? Bud looks away. Gekko's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let me cue you in: the ice is melting under your feet sport... Without warning, he grabs Buddy roughly by the lapels and lets out his inner rage with a series of smacks and slaps across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you could've gotten this far this fast with anybody else? You think you could be out there dicking somebody like Darien? No, you'd be cold calling dentists and widows to buy twenty shares of some dog stock! I took you in! A nobody! I opened doors for you!...I showed you how the system works!... Gekko slapping him harder and harder, Buddy staggering wi the blows, saying nothing, not defending himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the value of information! How you get it! Anacott Steel, Brant Resources, Transuniversal, Fulham Oil. And this is how you pay back, you cockroach! I gave you Darien, I gave you your manhood. I gave you everything. He backhands Bud across the face. Bud lies on the ground, spent, as is Gordon breathing hard. Bud gets to his knees blood streaming from his nose, his suit muddied. Passersb look on, wondering. Gekko seems to relent, the rage going into hurt, remorse. hands Bud a handkerchief. Bud staunches the flow of blood from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, innocently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've been one of the great ones Bud...I look at you and see myself...Why? Bud looks at Gordon, torn by mixed emotions: the bonds th share and the betrayal wrought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head, thoughtfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. My Dad once told me, "money is something you need in case you don't die tomortow." I guess I realized I'm just Bud Fox. And as much as I wanted to be Gordon Gekko--I'll always be Bud Fox. He looks at Gordon, as if wanting to say more, but doesn' In long shot, Gordon stands alone as Bud walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORMAN looks askance. Bud, mud-splattered suit and bloody nose, walks straight past him thru the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several well-heeled DINERS look up from their haute cuisi at the sight of Bud making his way toward the men's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on Bud, staring at his reflection in the mirror, as unbuttons his shirt, revealing adhesive tape swathed acro his chest. Camera paces back as he winces when... MORRISSEY and AGOSTINI, the two investigators, rip the ta off his chest, retrieving a small tape recorder. Morrisse of the S.E.C. rewinds the cassette. We hear Gekko's voice being played back on the tape, the mention of their deals

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing, Bud. Bud looks searchingly in the mirror. Faint CLICKING NOISE comes up over the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICKING of the Broad Tape grows LOUDER. Shots of Lou Mannheim, Lynch, Marv; silently looking up at the green fluorescent print-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, dressed in a suit and tie, sits at the dining table finished breakfast plates in front of him, refilling his coffee cup. Mom clearing off the table, anxious... As Bud walks in, wearing a suit and tie. He looks tired, beaten, the eyes lifeless, in a dark mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disapproving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...don't wear that tie Buddy, it... She cuts off on Bud's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks, I'm nervous enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's time to hit the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, don't want to be late for my own funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving towards the Federal Courtrooms in Lower Manhattan Busy traffic all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (supportively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you told the truth, you gave the money back. All things considered-- in this cockamamie world--you're shooting par...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you helped save the airline and the people at the airline are gonna remember you for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...if I was you, I'd think about that Bluestar job Wildman's offered you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm going to jail and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head, sober)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's the price, Bud, maybe so. It's gonna be rough on you but maybe in some screwed up way, that's the best thing that can happen to you...stop trading for the quick buck and go produce something with your life, create, don't live off the buying and selling of others...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you can do it, Bud, once you set your mind to something, I believe you can do anything in the world... Bud stares ahead, registering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...got any friends gonna be there? As he pulls the car into the curb. The Federal Building, approaching POV, looms large before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around, ironic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like who? Who really wants to know a convicted felon...I don't even like myself. Carl knows something Bud doesn't... Darien is standing there waiting as they approach the mai entrance... Bud seeing her, suddenly stunned. His POV-- easing along the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why don't you get out here and go in with your friend, I'll park the car. Try to be cool, okay? A last look with his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud getting out...crossing to Darien. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure a guy who's made some mistakes should be able to understand a girl who's made some of her own... Bud looking at her, moves closer, longing and hope and happiness have returned to his dull eyes... and forgivene the greatest of all. They embrace. Bud will never know about her past, nor nee he. The camera leaving them on a slanting, circular crane lifting past the Federal Building to a panorama of Wall Street in all its icy magisterial splendor...and thus end our tale.
